TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCActionManager extends System.Object implements class CocosSharp.ICCSelectorProtocol

summary.para: is a singleton that manages all the actions. Normally you won't need to use this singleton directly. 99% of the cases you will use the interface, which uses this singleton. But there are some cases where you might need to use this singleton. Examples:

item.description: When you want to run an action where the target is different from a Node.

remarks.description: When you want to run an action where the target is different from a Node.

item.description: When you want to pause / resume the actions

remarks.description: When you want to pause / resume the actions

public void AddAction (CocosSharp.CCAction action, CocosSharp.CCNode target, bool paused);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddAction(class CocosSharp.CCAction action, class CocosSharp.CCNode target, bool paused) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds an action with a target. If the target is already present, then the action will be added to the existing target. If the target is not present, a new instance of this target will be created either paused or not, and the action will be added to the newly created target. When the target is paused, the queued actions won't be 'ticked'.

Docs.summary: Returns the numbers of actions that are running in a certain target. Composable actions are counted as 1 action. Example:

remarks.para: Returns the numbers of actions that are running in a certain target. Composable actions are counted as 1 action. Example:

item.description: If you are running 1 Sequence of 7 actions, it will return 1.

remarks.description: If you are running 1 Sequence of 7 actions, it will return 1.

item.description: If you are running 7 Sequences of 2 actions, it will return 7.

remarks.description: If you are running 7 Sequences of 2 actions, it will return 7.

Docs.summary: Pauses all running actions, returning a list of targets whose actions were paused.

Docs.summary: Pauses the target: all running actions and newly added actions will be paused.
